occupation: VP, Product & Infrastructure at Obsidian Labs
headline: I build infrastructures. On the cloud. In the team.

experiences.title: VP, Product & Infrastructure
experiences.description: Obsidians Lab is the world leader in IDE toolkits for Blockchains. Founded by two Y-Combinator alumni, great minds with extensive experiences in blockchain world have come together to explore the forefront on blockchain development, providing tools to developers worldwide on leading public chains.Our IDE product family, being the most powerful and popular blockchain IDEs available on the market, integrates all necessary toolkits from environment setup, compilation, debug to deployment that serves a complete development lifecycle. Available in both web and desktop versions, our IDEs runs in major web browsers and OS, such as Windows, macOS or Linux and are trusted by developers in over 100 countries/regions.Our flagship IDE products, EOS Studio, Substrate IDE, CKB Studio, Conflux Studio, Algorand Studio, Alaya Studio have been officially recognized by their respective public chain foundations (EOS.IO, Web3 Foundation (Polkadot), Nervos (CKB), Conflux, Algorand, LatticeX (PlatON) ) as the official IDE to the developer communities.A few days ago, we’re thrilled to introduce Etherenum Studio and EVM-compatible BSC Studio, Heco Studio to our product family, extending our support further to thousands of developers developing on these booming blockchain platforms.* Lead product development for all Studio-series blockchain IDEs product family* Lead infrastructure design and implementation on the cloud (AWS, Tencent Cloud, Alibaba Cloud)* Lead international partnership development and liaison

experiences.title: IT Operations Manager Asia-Pacific
experiences.description: Build from scratch a multilingual & multi-site 17-people Operations team focusing on architecting, deploying and operating cloud-native application on public clouds. Certified experience on AWS/Alibaba Cloud and B/S structure multi-layer web application on public clouds.•	Make use of docker container clusters, Redis/Memcached cache and RDS services to build distributed web applications and microservices with AWS Lambda, NoSQL,  API Gateway and SQS.•	Experiences with common DevOps and project management tools like Jenkins, ELK, Ansible, Sentry, OpsGenie, Jira, Confluence and Github/Bitbucket.•	Responsible for infrastructure security and network compliance for China operations, familiarity with network concepts and tool of SDN, LAN, WAN, DNS, WAF and VPN as well as related regulations like ICP, Police registration and Network Security Law.•	Familiar with the service differences between AWS China and Global regions, hands on experience on making use of Ali-cloud services and Azure to complement. Persuaded Stockholm HQ to adapt a multi-cloud infrastructure with Ali-cloud and AWS for China Stronghold The localized architecture as made by AWS China as a user reference case.•	As an important communication bridge between China IT and global IT, worked as Cloud Architect in Korean CRM and China ECOM 2.0 project and coordinated throughout the project with local partner, China IT, local BU and HQ IT towards a solution respecting and support local business requirements without losing global unity.•	As China incident manager, taking the lead during APAC time zones in the follow-the-sun IT oncall routine, coordinated the procedure for incident and emergency plan for business cricital applications, and worked as the spokesman during incident towards company’s C-level officers.
experiences.location: Shenzhen, Guangdong, China and Hong Kong SAR, China

experiences.title: IT Support Manager China
experiences.description: Overseeing, Refining and Supporting Internal & Retail IT infrastructure for Daniel Wellington in the Greater China region. Agilely building a centrally-managed scalable IT infrastructure on the cloud to support European fastest-growing private company* doubling its turnover YoY to billion-scale in China in 2017 while always connected to our global infrastructure.What I do here:1. Supporting the cloud-based Internal IT infrastructure for DW China Offices:Keywords: Office 365, Cisco-Meraki networks, corporate IT policies, Sophos Security, MDM (Filewave), Apple DEP/VPP/EPP, Zendesk, airtame, printers and multimedia equipments.2. Refining the Internal IT infrastructure for better localization and global connectivity.Keywords: VPN(l2tp,pptp,shadowsocks), cross-border circuits, SDN  and SIP-based VoIP3.  IT infrastructure OperationsKeywords: AWS, Aliyun, Container(Docker AWS ECS), CI (Jenkins), DevOps, Redis, AWS RDS/DynamoDB, AWS Lambda4. Continuously Delivery of Infrastructure and Service to CN retail businessKeywords: Omnichannel retail, Integrated Mobile Payments(AliPay, Wechat Pay),  interactive in-store applications (with Social Media, Augment Reliability, Face Recognition etc.)Working closely with IT Support, Reliability and Operation Teams in Stockholm,Sweden, My team and I are based in Shenzhen, China taking care of IT infrastructure and services in 6 offices in Hong Kong, Shenzhen, and Shanghai, as well as 70+ stores across China mainland and Hong Kong.2015.10-2016.12 as IT Support Specialist China* Source: Inc 5000 Europe 2017 https://www.inc.com/inc5000eu/list/2017/
experiences.location: Shenzhen, Guangdong, China & Hong Kong SAR, China

recommendations: Edrick proved to be a fantastic person to work with. He understands complicated issues even when outside of his direct area of expertise and has exceptional experience in technology, culture understanding, problem solving oriented and fast learner. Working at Daniel wellington is most challenging, and he battled the impediments. Dedicated and goal oriented strategist that cannot be overestimated. Definitely someone I'd want to to have on my team again in the future.

Edrick was one of the most committed professionals through his work at Danielwellington. When you get to connect with him, you will find a fantastic person with unique skills! Thanks to interpersonal skills, he has excellent relations with both colleagues and customers. His organizational and technical skills have been invaluable to the company. Edrick will find a way to weather any storm with a smile. He learns quickly, and I would not doubt working with Edrick again in the future!
